title: PPG-based Heart Rate Estimation with Efficient Sensor Sampling and Learning Models. (arXiv:2303.13636v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Recent studies showed that Photoplethysmography (PPG) sensors embedded in wearable devices can estimate heart rate (HR) with high accuracy. However, despite of prior research efforts, applying PPG sensor based HR estimation to embedded devices still faces challenges due to the energy-intensive high-frequency PPG sampling and the resource-intensive machine-learning models. In this work, we aim to explore HR estimation techniques that are more suitable for lower-power and resource-constrained embedded devices. More specifically, we seek to design techniques that could provide high-accuracy HR estimation with low-frequency PPG sampling, small model size, and fast inference time. tldr: 本文研究了如何将PPG心率估计技术应用于低功耗和资源受限的嵌入式设备中，在结合信号处理和机器学习的基础上，成功将PPG采样频率降至仅25Hz，并提高了心率估计的精度，同时也减小了机器学习模型的特征大小，使得模型更小。
en_tdlr: This paper explores how to apply PPG heart rate estimation techniques to low-power and resource-constrained embedded devices. By combining signal processing and machine learning, the authors successfully reduced the PPG sampling frequency to only 25Hz while improving the accuracy of heart rate estimation, and minimized the feature size of the machine learning model, resulting in smaller models.
